intro: Caulinia tenuissima, commonly known as the slender caulinia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, narrow leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
